intro: Altensteinia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian altensteinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of Bolivia and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Altensteinia boliviensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
